de.javasoft.swing.jycombobox
Class ColorPopupPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  de.javasoft.swing.jycombobox.ColorPopupPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener
public class ColorPopupPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener

Predefined popup component for the color selection to be used together with a JYComboBox.

Version:
1.01, 14.02.2011
See Also:
JYComboBox.setPopupComponent(javax.swing.JComponent), Serialized Form

public java.awt.Color[] getColors()
Getter for the current color palette.

Returns:
All used colors.
See Also:
setColors(Color[])

createLinearColorPalette

public java.awt.Color[] createLinearColorPalette(int distance)
Creates a linear color palette which can be set to the panel. Ideally 6 color rows should be used to display all colors.

Parameters:
distance - Color value distance - ideally 256 divisible without remainder - i.e. 8, 16, 32, 64
See Also:
setColorRows(int), setColors(Color[])

createWebColorPalette

public java.awt.Color[] createWebColorPalette()
Creates a web color palette which can be set to the panel. Ideally 6 color rows should be used to display all colors.

See Also:
setColorRows(int), setColors(Color[])

createNaturalColorPalette

public java.awt.Color[] createNaturalColorPalette()
Creates a kind of a natural color palette which can be set to the panel. Ideally 7 color rows should be used to display all colors.

See Also:
setColorRows(int), setColors(Color[])
